org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common

Interface SchedulerEventListener

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DisconnectionAwareSchedulerEventListener, SchedulerEventListenerExtended
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSmartProxy, RestSmartProxyImpl, SmartProxyImpl, UniversalSchedulerListener

    @PublicAPI
public interface SchedulerEventListener
    Class providing events that the scheduler is able to send using the described listener. Each event may represent a group of similar events.
    The difference between events is specified by the SchedulerEvent contains in each events.
    Since:
    ProActive Scheduling 0.9

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void jobStateUpdatedEvent(NotificationData<JobInfo> notification)
      Invoked each time the state of a job has changed.
      If you want to maintain an up to date list of jobs, just use the JobState.update(org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.job.JobInfo) method to update the content of your job.
      void jobSubmittedEvent(JobState job)
      Invoked each time a new job has been submitted to the Scheduler and validated.
      void jobUpdatedFullDataEvent(JobState job)
      Invoked each time the state of a job has changed and each time a scheduler event occurs.
      void schedulerStateUpdatedEvent(SchedulerEvent eventType)
      Invoked each time a scheduler event occurs.
      Scheduler events are stopped,started, paused, frozen, etc.
      void taskStateUpdatedEvent(NotificationData<TaskInfo> notification)
      Invoked each time the state of a task has changed.
      In this case you can use the JobState.update(org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.TaskInfo) method to update the content of the designated task inside your job.
      void usersUpdatedEvent(NotificationData<UserIdentification> notification)
      Invoked each time something change about users.

    • Method Detail

      • schedulerStateUpdatedEvent

        void schedulerStateUpdatedEvent(SchedulerEvent eventType)
        Invoked each time a scheduler event occurs.
        Scheduler events are stopped,started, paused, frozen, etc.
        Parameters:
        eventType - the type of the event received.

      • jobSubmittedEvent

        void jobSubmittedEvent(JobState job)
        Invoked each time a new job has been submitted to the Scheduler and validated.
        Parameters:
        job - the newly submitted job.

      • jobStateUpdatedEvent

        void jobStateUpdatedEvent(NotificationData<JobInfo> notification)
        Invoked each time the state of a job has changed.
        If you want to maintain an up to date list of jobs, just use the JobState.update(org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.job.JobInfo) method to update the content of your job.
        Parameters:
        notification - the data composed of the type of the event and the information that have change in the job.

      • jobUpdatedFullDataEvent

        void jobUpdatedFullDataEvent(JobState job)
        Invoked each time the state of a job has changed and each time a scheduler event occurs.
        Parameters:
        job - the updated job.

      • taskStateUpdatedEvent

        void taskStateUpdatedEvent(NotificationData<TaskInfo> notification)
        Invoked each time the state of a task has changed.
        In this case you can use the JobState.update(org.ow2.proactive.scheduler.common.task.TaskInfo) method to update the content of the designated task inside your job.
        Parameters:
        notification - the data composed of the type of the event and the information that have change in the task.

      • usersUpdatedEvent

        void usersUpdatedEvent(NotificationData<UserIdentification> notification)
        Invoked each time something change about users.
        Parameters:
        notification - the data composed of the type of the event and the data linked to the change.
